column2: The corridor was lined with framed certificates.
I noticed the neat handwriting on each.
A clock ticked steadily on the wall.
He glanced up as the second hand moved.
The air felt slightly cool indoors.
A quiet hum drifted from the lights above.
I heard footsteps approaching in the distance.
The door closed with a gentle click.
I adjusted my position in the chair.
Notes lay spread across the table.
She pointed to a particular line.
Everything appeared to be in order.
I put the papers back into my folder.
The folder was tucked under my arm.
We stepped out into the hallway again.
Natural light poured through the skylight.
The marble floor gleamed beneath our feet.
She commented on the modern design.
We made our way towards the exit.
A street performer played the violin.
Coins clinked in the open case.
The tune was full of emotion.
I dropped a pound coin in thanks.
He stopped to check his watch.
It was only just after eleven.
We had time for a brief stroll.
A nearby market caught our interest.
Stalls were arranged in neat rows.
The colours were bright and inviting.
She picked up a ripe apple.
I examined a bunch of grapes.
The vendor offered a small sample.
A scent of fresh bread lingered nearby.
It came from a small bakery stall.
Warm loaves sat on a wooden shelf.
The bag felt warm in my hands.
We found a quiet place to sit.
A wooden bench stood under a tree.
She broke off a small piece of bread.
I leaned back and closed my eyes.
He checked his phone once more.
I stood and brushed off my trousers.
We searched for a nearby café.
One stood on the opposite corner.
We selected a table for two.
He pulled out a chair politely.
I thanked him with a smile.
The menu offered a wide selection.
Soups, salads and sandwiches were listed.
He opted for a chicken sandwich.
The glass felt cool and smooth.
A steaming bowl was placed in front of me.
A barista called out an order.
Rain began to tap against the window.
We finished the last few bites.
A small dessert menu was offered.
The rich scent filled the air.
It arrived on a small tray.
He held the door open for me.
I stepped out onto the pavement.
The air smelled fresh after rain.
We discussed where to go next.
A guide spoke quietly to a group.
I felt a sense of wonder.
We moved on to the next exhibit.
Ancient artefacts lay in glass cases.
Footsteps echoed on the stone floor.
Eventually, we reached the final hall.
A huge sculpture stood in the centre.
Every angle told a different story.
A bench invited us to sit.
We thanked the attendant on the way out.
